title: Bicyclist fatally struck by hit-and-run driver, Prince George’s County police said
text:
Police are at the scene of a crash where a man on a bike was fatally struck from behind by a vehicle near Accokeek Road in Brandywine. (Prince George's County police)

A man riding a bike died after he was struck by a vehicle Wednesday morning in a hit-and-run incident along a road in Prince George’s County, authorities said.

The man’s name was not released, pending notification of his family.

Prince George’s County police said the incident happened around 6:20 a.m. at McKendree and Accokeek roads in Brandywine. Officers responded to the area after receiving a call to check on someone’s welfare.

When they arrived, they found a man lying on the grassy area beside the roadway, police said.

Authorities said the man was taken to a hospital where he was pronounced dead.

The incident is under investigation but an initial finding was that the man was riding his bike north on McKendree Road when he was “struck by a vehicle from behind,” police said.

In a message on Twitter, police said “that vehicle did not stop.” Officials said the vehicle “most likely has front end damage.”

No description of the vehicle was given at this time.

Cpl. Nicholas Clayton, a spokesman for the Prince George’s County police, said the stretch of road where the incident occurred is dangerous.

“It’s a two-way road with trees on both sides, no sidewalks, no shoulder and no streetlights,” Clayton said. “It’s not a good place for a pedestrian to be riding a bike, even during the day.”

On Wednesday when the crash happened, Clayton said the narrow road was wet, and it was dark, making for a “recipe for disaster.”

He said authorities are “hoping the person” who was driving the vehicle “comes forward.”
